page.title: 11THE LIFEBOAT CREW, RHYL
page.content: The "Harlil" can carry 35 people in addition to its crew of 7. The crew are all volunteers with other occupations. Only the mechanic is paid by the R.N.L.I. for 4 hours work daily. No ladies are in the present crew but there was one on the inshore boat in the 1970s. Training exercises take place every six weeks. Since June, 1982, personal bleepers have been used to call out the men. Before this 2 rockets were fired but these are used tday merely to inform the public of a launch. The Holyhead Coastguard informs the Hon. Sec. when a boat is required. An auxillary coastguard station at the Lifeboat station is only manned in bad weather and at rescue times. An amphibious tractor launches the boat which only requires 1 metre of water. Launching takes 4-7 mins. according to the tide.
